frameDefinitions: A Questioner asks a Witness (or defendant) questions in the context of a court procedure.
A Controlling_entity has control of a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
A Cognizer decides upon the Chosen (either an item or a course of action) out of a set of  Possibilities .
These adjectives describe the degree of strictness or tolerance of an Agent, usually with regard to another person (the Controllee) and often with regard to a particular Issue.
An Agent or Cause limits a Range_of_options to having a certain Characteristic.
A Controlling_entity, Controlling_situation, or Controlling_variable control a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
frameExamples: We 'd like to <t>cross-examine</t> the witness if we can.
She was in <t>control</t> of the empire within two days.
The council <t>picked</t> you out of all the pilots available to head this mission.
Court says judge too <t>lenient</t> in rape case.INI
His choices in life have <t>limited</t> his opportunities severely.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual who asks a <fen>Witness</fen> questions.
A person who is present in a courtroom in order to give some form of evidence, has been sworn in, and is being examined by a <fen>Questioner</fen>.
When the examination occurs.
Where the examination takes place.
A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> effects the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the controlling occurs.
The location at which the controlling occurs.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> chooses the <fen>Chosen</fen> out of the <fen>Possibilities</fen>.
<fen>Chosen</fen> identifies the entity or course of action which is selected from among the <fen>Possibilities</fen>.

A <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes a choice from among a set of <fen>Possibilities</fen>. <fen>Possibilities</fen> are commonly expressed via an oblique phrase which indicates the alternative or alternatives, or by a subordinate clause (choosing to do it or choosing not to do it), typically headed by 'whether or 'if'.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> chooses the <fen>Chosen</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the choosing occurs.

The Agent is the person who is strict or liberal in his/her control over another. This role is usually the External Argument with predicate adjectives, or the head noun if the adjective is used attributively: <fex name='Agent'>The school</fex> is very <t>liberal</t> in approach and curriculum. I attended a very <t>liberal</t> <fex name='Agent'>school</fex>.

The Agent's strictness may be directed towards or limited to some particular person or group over whom he/she has control.  The Controlled_entity generally occurs in a PP Complement.
Grandparents are often <t>indulgent</t> <fex name='Controlled_entity'>with their grandchildren</fex>.
The Agent's strictness may be manifested in particular behavior: The judge was <t>lenient</t> <fex name='Controlling_act'>in dealing with the offender</fex>.

The Agent may be strict or lenient with respect to a particular matter or situation.  Issue occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by <ment>about</ment>: The city council is <t>strict</t> <fex name='Issue'>about pollution control</fex>.

A Medium of control, such as rules, may also be described as strict or lenient.  Medium may occur with or without the Agent who ultimately has control (i.e. the one who implements or enforces the rules). The club has <t>strict</t> <fex name='Medium'>rules</fex> about who can become a member. <fex name='Medium'>Immigration law</fex> is very <t>strict</t>.
The body part or expression of the <fen>Agent</fen> that indicates their strictness.
The <fen>Agent</fen> consciously places limits upon the Range_of_options.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is a natural occurrence or state-of-affairs that limits the Range_of_options.

The <fen>Range_of_options</fen> would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but is limited by an <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> to particular subtypes, situations or characteristics.
The <fen>Characteristic</fen> indicates the subtypes or situations to which the <fen>Range_of_options</fen> is limited.
The time at which the limiting takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> limits the <fen>Range_of_options</fen>.
A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> or an <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>.
A scalar variable (with unspecified value) which has an effect on the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>, <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>, or <fen>Controlling_variable</fen>.
A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>, a <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>, or a <fen>Controlling_variable</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics control a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
The <fex name='deg'>Degree</fex> to which the Controlling element affects the Dependent element.
The <fex name='tim'>Time</fex> at which the controlling occurs.
The location at which the controlling occurs.
listRoleExamples: You have leave to examine <fex>the witness.</fex>
Move the slider on the SpeedBar while playing audio or video material to control <fex>playback speed</fex>.
<fex>We</fex>have to pick a colour for the living room.
I decided <fex>to give it another try</fex>.
They chose their new guitarist <fex>out of more than 300 auditioners</fex>.
I was n't chosen <fex>in the last round</fex>.
The winner was selected <fex>in the secret meeting room</fex>.
I like to think he quaked under my authoritarian <fex>glare</fex>.
<fex>The military</fex> limited building access to key personnel.
<fex>Ongoing rains</fex> have limited drivers to a small number of roads.
The military limited <fex>building access</fex> to key personnel.
The military limited access <fex>to key personnel only</fex>.
Banks are <fex>currently</fex> limiting customers to two cash transactions per day.
Move the slider on the SpeedBar while playing audio or video material to control <fex>playback speed</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Demo In Schools To Instil Awareness Among Students -- NohKUALA LUMPUR
the Human Rights Commission of Malaysia
